content.rendered: Thank you, Pat. I was grateful to the Lord for unjamming my emotions so I could write again!

Joan, once again you have captured so beautifully our loving and kind God, even in the midst of your new sorrow. Our Fathet who knows our sorrows and ‚Äúlifts our heads.‚Äù I am so blessed by you and to call you my friend.

Thank you, Joan
Great thoughts to be mindful of.
What a God given talent you have. Thank you for sharing
Brenda
Thank you, Pat. I feel relieved to have finally gotten my swirling thoughts down. So much has transpired in these weeks since Covid arrived.
Thank you. Beautifully written. God is so faithful to us, we need to pray for our faithfulness to Him.

I agree…things that seemed so pressing are no longer a priority. I homeschooled my children for 5 years, and didn‚Äôt realize how much I missed their presence (presents) in my daily life. In this age of FaceTime, texting, emailing, and other digital ways of communicating, I have lost the value of a real touch, and a concerned friend looking me in the eye and asking how I am REALLY doing. It doesn‚Äôt seem that important until it‚Äôs not there. Thank you fir reminding me of that!‚ù§Ô∏è

‚ÄúWhose woods these are, I think I know…
His house is in the village though..
He will not see me stopping here
to watch the woods fill up with snow.‚Äù
Robert Frost

I agree that God gives us messages of His Peace and Presence in Nature‚Äîsometimes when we least expect them. It‚Äôs our job to stay tuned in to His voice…and give Him a few moments of appreciation for His loving care, even when we have ‚Äúpromises to keep and miles
to go before we sleep.‚Äù

Thank you for reminding us to be open to Him Words‚Äîsometimes delivered in the most unusual ways.
I love to be reminded He has plans for us and a perfect path to follow. Thank you for a beautiful reminder of this today‚ù§Ô∏èüôè
That He does. He‚Äôs always ready to redirect us when we miss our cues. ‚ù§Ô∏è
And when I do go astray off the path my good shepherd finds me and leads me back to His perfect way.
Thank you Joan. Beautiful, simple truth. Spoken from your heart to your readers.
Joan, what truth there is in that. We all need reminded! Thank you
Simply beautiful Joan.
Joan, you never disappoint with your sweet, honest love of our Savior. May your reflections comfort all those that need to feel His Presence‚ù§Ô∏è

Your example of God‚Äôs hidden forces ready to fight for/with Elisha is powerful! Great example of His living care & provision for us even when we think our situation is hopeless!
And I love your explanation of salvation, avoiding hackneyed expressions & selecting new ways to clarify what & why Christ died for us. Now He leaves it up to us to accept His free ‚Äúgift of relationship‚Äù and align our lives with Him…or not.
Elaine
It’s so easy to miss “seeing” beyond the moment when we face trials. I’m keeping this as my ongoing prayer when I cannot see His provision. Thank you, Jean, for dropping by.
Yes! Seeing life thru eyes of faith brings comfort, peace and even joy when trials and burdens threaten around us.
Thank you for your thoughtful response!

The special bouquet of sunflowers Max so thoughtfully gave you was so full of meaning!! I can‚Äôt help but love him for his targeted explanation, but then I also love you for pulling out the significant spiritual application. Yes, we all need the sun, but more importantly, The Son! Life would be dull & droopy without His Life-giving Strength for each day. He is the only one who can permanently lift up our heads to see the beauty around us now & give us assurance of eternal life in the future…living gloriously with Him!!! üåª

Thank you for your honesty! I may be present, but not always there for others. I hope my children find a power greater than themselves to be with them and guide them through life, because I am most certainly not it!

Oh Joan, thank you so much for this encouraging word through your vivid writing and imagery. I come away encouraged, emboldened, and empowered to put on God’s holy armor! Thank you for reminding us of these simple yet powerful truths!

This spoke to me Joan. God often speaks to me in my dreams. In years past I didn‚Äôt share what I was told in those dreams. Now, if it involves another person, I‚Äôll call that person and discuss the message. These conversations have been amazing, healing and soul transforming. Thank you for sharing this message.
Excellent, Joan! I love the way you captured an everyday comment with a spiritual message – and so beautifully too! Thanks!

Amen and amen! What a timely reminder for us to keep vigilant so that we might finish well. Thank you for sharing your insights, I love how the Holy Spirit speaks to you and through you. What an apt example you paint with the once beautiful flowers to the resulting dead sprays due to the consequences of nonvigilance. May we all be encouraged to stay alert and self-control as we persevere and endure towards the aim of godliness!

As usual, when I encounter your words, whether I hear them or read them, I feel a moment of peace! Sometimes it‚Äôs fleeting, but at other times, it settles my agitation long enough to open my mind to possibilities I never knew existed in there! Progress; not perfection!
Thank you! It was hard to express such “BIGNESS”! üôÇ
Your words stir my soul with renewed awe at God‚Äôs sovereignty and love for us..at his humanly inexplicable design for our salvation & relationship with him!!! So beautiful!!!

author_name: Thanks for presenting adoption as such a fulfilling choice !!!

content.rendered: Sobering truths. I pray for moms who are considering abortion to open their hearts & minds to the life-giving option of adoption! What joy to know your little one lives‚Äîeven if not with you! you
I like, very good
Great way to present this reasonable option! Praying that God will use your message to save the lives of many unborn children!
If only we would learn to learn to appreciate & rely upon God’s leash, our lives would be much more peaceful & full of joy!
Interesting information…new to me…but it makes sense that an abortion will impact future relationships! Elaine J

Joan thanks so much for sharing with us. Your writings are so wonderful! I love the way you present the analogy on life. The different stages of life. We are approaching the final years. I hope I don‚Äôt disappoint my Lord. He has given so much to us. Appreciate you!!!

Letha

Would love to read the whole article. However, when I click on the link I get this message:
“This page can‚Äôt be displayed.” (Elaine J)
Beautiful winter picture! Great “show me” action to bring your childhood winters to life. Strong statements about your identity in each of the seasons. Wonderful explanation of our need for a Savior!
Her writing was very enlightening. please share on.

Thank you for reading, and please sign up on the Blog (now that it’s available to do so) and you will receive updates when I post something new. Writing about “Life Stories” now. üôÇ Share with others you think might have a need to hear, or an appreciation for the cause. Thanks!
Finally writing on the Blog again if you care to check it out. Hope you are well.
Thank you very much, Ruthie. I appreciate your kind feedback.
Thank you so much! Please sign up for updates on the front page of the Blog. I promise I won’t flood your Inbox. LOL.
Joan, you write beautifully and I am enjoying your posts! I feel like I am right there experiencing what you write. Thank you so much!!
Incredible beauty and truth in word
Well thought out message that we should all hear. Thanks
Beautiful Joan!
Thanks for adding this comment, Deb. i agree!
God is love and love is creative . . . . His love spilled over from the Trinity and created us.
